content:
I'm generating Bundles for my resources but for some reason I don't see them in the generated IG, the config I use is

groups:
  H2Q-MC-LZZT-Design:
    name: H2Q-MC-LZZT Study Design Resources
    description: Example Design Instances for H2Q-MC-LZZT
    resources:
    - ResearchStudy/H2Q-MC-LZZT-ResearchStudy
    - PlanDefinition/H2Q-MC-LZZT-ProtocolDesign
    - Group/H2Q-MC-LZZT-ResearchStudy-Inclusion
    - Group/H2Q-MC-LZZT-ResearchStudy-Exclusion
    - PlanDefinition/H2Q-MC-LZZT-Study-Visit-1
    - PlanDefinition/H2Q-MC-LZZT-Study-Visit-2
  Deliverables:
    name: Deliverables
    description: Deliverables for H2Q-MC-LZZT
    resources:
    - Bundle/H2Q-MC-LZZT-Bundle-1
    - Bundle/H2Q-MC-LZZT-Bundle-2

In the generated IG I see the former as expected, but the latter seems to be unresolvable. Is there something special about Bundles?
I have bundles showing, but I also noticed that not all of my bundle examples are showing in the artifacts page
I see my bundle examples in the sushi output, and they are mentioned in the implementation guide json that sushi creates. So it seems in the IG they are getting lost -- for me.
I even do see the html rendering of these examples in the output folder... they are just missing from the artifacts.html
This is a publisher issue, not a SUSHI issue.
I thought it may be that. My interest was in whether it was intentional or not. Thanks
